intro: Campylospermum bernieri, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Campylospermum bernieri is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
